definitions.definition: the process of coming to live permanently in a different country from the one you were born in; the number of people who do this

examples.text: We are strongly supportive of immigration and multiculturalism.
laws restricting immigration into the US
There was an increase in immigration from Eastern Europe.
The power to enforce immigration laws lies with the federal government.
They announced measures to discourage illegal immigration.
She managed to put one woman in touch with a local immigration lawyer.

definitions.definition: the place at a port, an airport, etc. where the passports and other documents of people coming into a country are checked

examples.text: We landed at Heathrow and went through customs and immigration.
The men were interviewed by immigration officials.
